test_cases.Title: ProbableLineupFULL_001_Integration_PrematchView_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the Betting Sisal platform on Desktop and navigate to the prematch view for an upcoming football match.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the probable lineups are displayed, sourced from the Fantacalcio ProbableLineupFULL API.
Steps.Expected Result: Probable lineups for both teams are visible and match the data from the API.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into the Betting Sisal platform.
2. Fantacalcio APIs are integrated and reachable.
3. At least one upcoming football match is available in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Upcoming football match ID, valid user credentials, API response sample for ProbableLineupFULL.
test_cases.Expected Result: The prematch view displays probable lineups for both teams, accurately reflecting the data from the Fantacalcio ProbableLineupFULL API.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only probable lineups rendering from Fantacalcio API.

test_cases.Title: OfficialLineup_002_Integration_PrematchView_TEST_Mobile

Steps.Step Description: Open the Betting Sisal mobile app and navigate to the prematch view for a match with official lineups available.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch view loads for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the official lineups are displayed, sourced from the Fantacalcio API.
Steps.Expected Result: Official lineups for both teams are shown and match the API data.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into the Betting Sisal mobile app.
2. Fantacalcio APIs are integrated and reachable.
3. The selected match has official lineups available in the API.
test_cases.Dataset: Football match with official lineups, valid user credentials, API response for official lineups.
test_cases.Expected Result: Official lineups are displayed in the prematch view, matching the Fantacalcio API data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only official lineups rendering from Fantacalcio API.

test_cases.Title: PlayerOwnershipPercentage_003_Integration_PrematchView_TEST_AppIOS

Steps.Step Description: Launch the Betting Sisal iOS app and access the prematch view for a football match.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each player in the lineup has a displayed ownership percentage, as provided by the Fantacalcio API.
Steps.Expected Result: Ownership percentages are visible for all players and match the API data.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into the Betting Sisal iOS app.
2. Fantacalcio APIs are integrated and reachable.
3. The selected match has player ownership percentage data available in the API.
test_cases.Dataset: Football match with player ownership data, valid user credentials, API response for ownership percentages.
test_cases.Expected Result: Player ownership percentages are displayed and accurately reflect the Fantacalcio API data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only player ownership percentage rendering from Fantacalcio API.

test_cases.Title: PlayerStatus_004_Integration_PrematchView_TEST_DesktopMac

Steps.Step Description: Access the Betting Sisal platform on a Mac and navigate to the prematch view for a football match.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Check that players with special statuses (e.g., suspended, injured, cautioned) are indicated as such, based on Fantacalcio API data.
Steps.Expected Result: Players with special statuses are clearly marked (e.g., icon, label) and match the API data.

2. Fantacalcio APIs are integrated and reachable.

test_cases.Expected Result: Players with special statuses are correctly marked in the prematch view, reflecting the Fantacalcio API data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only player status rendering from Fantacalcio API.

test_cases.Title: TeamNewsSection_005_Integration_PrematchView_TEST_AppAndroid

Steps.Step Description: Open the Betting Sisal Android app and navigate to the prematch view for a football match.

test_cases.Title: APIFailure_006_ErrorHandling_PrematchView_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a failure in the Fantacalcio API (e.g., API returns 500 error) while accessing the prematch view on Desktop.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch view attempts to load data from Fantacalcio API.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the behavior of the prematch view when API data is unavailable.
Steps.Expected Result: A user-friendly error message or fallback content is displayed, and the application does not crash.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into the Betting Sisal platform.
2. Fantacalcio API is temporarily unavailable or returns an error.
3. At least one upcoming football match is available in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Simulated API failure (e.g., 500 error), valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: The prematch view displays a user-friendly error or fallback content when Fantacalcio API data is unavailable, without crashing.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for Fantacalcio API failures.

test_cases.Title: CrossBrandRendering_007_Compatibility_PrematchView_TEST_Terminale

Steps.Step Description: Access the Betting Sisal platform from a terminal device under a different brand (if applicable) and navigate to the prematch view for a football match.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all Fantacalcio API data (probable lineups, official lineups, player percentages, statuses, team news) are rendered correctly for the brand.
Steps.Expected Result: All Fantacalcio API data is displayed and formatted correctly, regardless of the brand.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into the Betting Sisal platform on a terminal device under a different brand.
2. Fantacalcio APIs are integrated and reachable.
3. The selected match has all relevant data available in the API.
test_cases.Dataset: Terminal device, different brand configuration, football match with full API data, valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API data is rendered correctly for all brands and device types supported by the platform.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cross-brand compatibility for Fantacalcio API data rendering.

test_cases.Title: API_Precondition_Validation_RU1_FantacalcioAPI_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the Fantacalcio API endpoint is accessible from the test environment.
Steps.Expected Result: The API endpoint responds to a basic connectivity check (e.g., ping or curl).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the required authentication credentials (e.g., API key, OAuth token) are available and valid.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication credentials are present and accepted by the API.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the user account (if required) is active and has the necessary permissions to access the Fantacalcio API.
Steps.Expected Result: User account is active and authorized for API usage.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to make a simple GET request to a public endpoint of the Fantacalcio API (e.g., fetch league information).
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns a successful response (HTTP 200) with expected data structure.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Test environment has network access to the Fantacalcio API endpoint.
2. Valid API credentials are provisioned.
3. User account is active and authorized.
4. API documentation is available for reference.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid API credentials, active user account, API endpoint URL.
test_cases.Expected Result: All preconditions for using the Fantacalcio API are satisfied: endpoint is reachable, credentials are valid, user is authorized, and a basic API call succeeds.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the precondition checks for API usage, not the full API functionality.

test_cases.Title: API_Precondition_InvalidCredentials_RU1_FantacalcioAPI_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the Fantacalcio API endpoint using invalid or expired credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns an authentication error (e.g., HTTP 401 Unauthorized).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the error message or code returned by the API.
Steps.Expected Result: The error message clearly indicates invalid or expired credentials.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Test environment has network access to the Fantacalcio API endpoint.
2. Invalid or expired API credentials are available for testing.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid or expired API credentials, API endpoint URL.
test_cases.Expected Result: The Fantacalcio API correctly rejects invalid or expired credentials and returns an appropriate error message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for API authentication precondition.

test_cases.Title: API_Precondition_MissingPermissions_RU1_FantacalcioAPI_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Use valid credentials for a user account lacking necessary permissions to access the Fantacalcio API.
Steps.Expected Result: The API processes the authentication but checks for permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access a restricted endpoint or perform an action requiring elevated permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns a permissions error (e.g., HTTP 403 Forbidden).

Steps.Step Description: Review the error message or code returned by the API.
Steps.Expected Result: The error message clearly indicates insufficient permissions.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Test environment has network access to the Fantacalcio API endpoint.
2. Valid API credentials for a user with insufficient permissions are available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid credentials for a user with insufficient permissions, API endpoint URL.
test_cases.Expected Result: The Fantacalcio API denies access to users without sufficient permissions and provides a clear error message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for user permissions precondition.

test_cases.Title: API_Precondition_EndpointUnreachable_RU1_FantacalcioAPI_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Simulate network unavailability or misconfigure the API endpoint URL.
Steps.Expected Result: The API endpoint is not reachable from the test environment.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to send a request to the Fantacalcio API endpoint.
Steps.Expected Result: The request fails due to network error or DNS resolution failure.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the error or timeout behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear network or connection error is reported to the user or system.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Test environment is configured to block network access or use an incorrect API endpoint URL.
test_cases.Dataset: Incorrect API endpoint URL or network configuration.
test_cases.Expected Result: The Fantacalcio API is not reachable and the system reports a clear network error.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for API endpoint reachability precondition.

test_cases.Title: OPTA_MappingFeed_001_Requirement_OPTA_MappingsFeed_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Access the OPTA Mappings Feed API endpoint as documented.
Steps.Expected Result: API endpoint is reachable and responds to requests.

Steps.Step Description: Submit a valid XML payload containing an Opta ID to the API.
Steps.Expected Result: API processes the request and returns a response.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the response contains the correct SDAPI ID mapped to the provided Opta ID.
Steps.Expected Result: Returned SDAPI ID matches the expected mapping for the given Opta ID.

1. OPTA Mappings Feed API is deployed and accessible.
2. Valid Opta IDs and their corresponding SDAPI IDs are available for reference.
3. Tester has network access to the API endpoint.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample Opta IDs with known SDAPI mappings.
test_cases.Expected Result: The API correctly maps and returns the SDAPI ID for a given valid Opta ID in XML format.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers positive scenario for valid ID mapping.

test_cases.Title: OPTA_MappingFeed_002_Requirement_OPTA_MappingsFeed_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Verify the response for appropriate error handling (e.g., error code, message indicating ID not found).

2. Tester has a list of invalid or non-existent Opta IDs.
3. Network access to the API endpoint is available.

test_cases.Title: OPTA_MappingFeed_004_Requirement_OPTA_MappingsFeed_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Access the OPTA Mappings Feed API endpoint.
Steps.Expected Result: API endpoint is reachable.

Steps.Step Description: Submit multiple valid XML payloads in rapid succession (simulate concurrent requests).
Steps.Expected Result: API processes all requests without error or performance degradation.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all responses are correct and timely.
Steps.Expected Result: All responses contain correct SDAPI IDs and are returned within acceptable response times.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. OPTA Mappings Feed API is deployed and accessible.
2. Multiple valid Opta IDs are available.
3. Tools/scripts for simulating concurrent requests are ready.
4. Network access to the API endpoint is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Multiple valid Opta IDs for concurrent requests.
test_cases.Expected Result: The API handles concurrent requests efficiently, returning correct mappings without errors or significant delays.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers performance and concurrency aspects.

test_cases.Title: OPTA_MappingFeed_005_Requirement_OPTA_MappingsFeed_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Access the OPTA Mappings Feed API endpoint.
Steps.Expected Result: API endpoint is reachable.

Steps.Step Description: Submit an XML payload with an Opta ID that is mapped to multiple SDAPI IDs (if such a case exists).
Steps.Expected Result: API processes the request and returns a response.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the response for correct handling of multiple mappings (e.g., returns all mapped SDAPI IDs or a clear indication of ambiguity).
Steps.Expected Result: API returns all mapped SDAPI IDs or a clear message indicating multiple mappings.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. OPTA Mappings Feed API is deployed and accessible.
2. At least one Opta ID with multiple SDAPI mappings is available (or simulated).
3. Network access to the API endpoint is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Opta IDs with multiple SDAPI mappings (if applicable).
test_cases.Expected Result: The API correctly handles cases where an Opta ID maps to multiple SDAPI IDs, providing all relevant information.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers edge case for multiple mappings.

User has valid credentials and access to the application. 3. The application is deployed with the latest release containing the Fantacalcio prioritization feature.

test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio is displayed as the provider for the prematch pitch view for Serie A under Sisal brand.

Steps.Step Description: Access the web application as an end user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the homepage.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Calcio' (Football) section.
Steps.Expected Result: The list of football competitions (manifestazioni) is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Serie A' competition under the 'Sisal' brand.
Steps.Expected Result: The competition details for Serie A under Sisal are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the live matches tab for Serie A under Sisal.
Steps.Expected Result: The live pitch view for Serie A under Sisal is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the provider of the live pitch view.
Steps.Expected Result: The live pitch view is provided by V4 Soccer Sportradar, not Fantacalcio.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Fantacalcio is configured as the prioritized provider for prematch pitch view for Serie A under Sisal brand. 2. User has valid credentials and access to the application. 3. The application is deployed with the latest release containing the Fantacalcio prioritization feature.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials (e.g., testuser1/testpass), Serie A as competition, Sisal as brand.
test_cases.Expected Result: V4 Soccer Sportradar is displayed as the provider for the live pitch view for Serie A under Sisal brand, regardless of Fantacalcio prioritization for prematch.

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio_Exclusion_RecuperoMatch_RU4_MatchDay_API_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the MatchCalendar API for the relevant competition (e.g., Serie A).
Steps.Expected Result: MatchCalendar API returns a list of matches with their associated Match Day values.

Steps.Step Description: Identify all matches currently quoted in the Sisal palinsesto for the competition.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of quoted matches is available, including both recupero (make-up) matches and regular matches.

Steps.Step Description: Determine the highest Match Day value among all matches returned by the API.
Steps.Expected Result: The highest Match Day value is correctly identified (e.g., 20 if matches for Match Day 20 are present).

Steps.Step Description: For each quoted match, check if its Match Day equals the highest Match Day value.
Steps.Expected Result: Matches are correctly classified as either current/imminent (Match Day = highest) or recupero (Match Day < highest).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Fantacalcio API is used only for matches with the highest Match Day value.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is called only for matches with the highest Match Day value.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for recupero matches (Match Day < highest), Fantacalcio API is not used and Sportradar is used for official lineups only.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not called for recupero matches; Sportradar is used for official lineups.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Sisal palinsesto contains both recupero and current/imminent matches for the same competition.
2. MatchCalendar API is accessible and returns up-to-date data.
3. Fantacalcio and Sportradar APIs are integrated and available.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample MatchCalendar API response with matches for multiple Match Days (e.g., Match Day 7 and Match Day 20), Sisal palinsesto with quoted matches for both days.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is used exclusively for matches with the highest Match Day value; recupero matches use Sportradar for official lineups only.
test_cases._polarion: Esclusione Fantacalcio su specifico match  Recuperi e Match Day (RU 4)

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio_Exclusion_OnlyCurrentMatchDay_RU4_MatchDay_API_TEST_Mobile

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sisal mobile app and navigate to the football betting section for the relevant competition.
Steps.Expected Result: Football betting section displays all quoted matches for the competition.

Steps.Step Description: Check the displayed matches and note their Match Day values (should be visible in the backend or via API logs).
Steps.Expected Result: Match Day values for each match are identified.

Steps.Step Description: Place a bet on a match with the highest Match Day value.
Steps.Expected Result: Betting process proceeds normally; Fantacalcio data is used for this match.

Steps.Step Description: Place a bet on a recupero match (Match Day < highest).
Steps.Expected Result: Betting process proceeds; Fantacalcio data is not used for this match; only Sportradar data is available.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Sisal mobile app is installed and user is logged in.
2. Quoted matches for both recupero and current Match Day are present in the app.
3. Backend logs or API monitoring is available to verify data source usage.
test_cases.Dataset: User account with betting permissions; matches for both Match Day 7 (recupero) and Match Day 20 (current) available in the app.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio data is used only for bets on matches with the highest Match Day; recupero matches use Sportradar data only.
test_cases._polarion: Esclusione Fantacalcio su specifico match  Recuperi e Match Day (RU 4)

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio_Exclusion_NoCurrentMatchDay_RU4_MatchDay_API_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the MatchCalendar API for the relevant competition where only recupero matches are quoted (no matches for the highest Match Day are present).
Steps.Expected Result: MatchCalendar API returns only matches with lower Match Day values (e.g., only Match Day 7).

Steps.Step Description: Verify which data source is used for these matches in the Sisal palinsesto.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not used for any of these matches; Sportradar is used for official lineups.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Sisal palinsesto contains only recupero matches (no matches for the highest Match Day).
2. MatchCalendar API is accessible and returns only lower Match Day values.
3. Fantacalcio and Sportradar APIs are integrated and available.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample MatchCalendar API response with only recupero matches (e.g., only Match Day 7).
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not used when only recupero matches are present; Sportradar is used for official lineups.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers the edge case where no current or imminent Match Day matches are present.
test_cases._polarion: Esclusione Fantacalcio su specifico match  Recuperi e Match Day (RU 4)

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio_Exclusion_MatchDayBoundary_RU4_MatchDay_API_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the MatchCalendar API for the relevant competition with matches for two consecutive Match Days (e.g., 19 and 20) quoted in the palinsesto.
Steps.Expected Result: MatchCalendar API returns matches for both Match Day 19 and 20.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Fantacalcio API is used only for matches with the highest Match Day (e.g., 20).
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is used only for Match Day 20 matches.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for matches with the lower Match Day (e.g., 19), Fantacalcio API is not used and Sportradar is used for official lineups.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not used for Match Day 19 matches; Sportradar is used for official lineups.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Sisal palinsesto contains quoted matches for two consecutive Match Days.
2. MatchCalendar API is accessible and returns both Match Days.
3. Fantacalcio and Sportradar APIs are integrated and available.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample MatchCalendar API response with matches for Match Day 19 and 20; Sisal palinsesto with quoted matches for both days.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is used only for matches with the highest Match Day; lower Match Day matches use Sportradar only.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers boundary condition with consecutive Match Days.
test_cases._polarion: Esclusione Fantacalcio su specifico match  Recuperi e Match Day (RU 4)

test_cases.Title: Fallback_SportradarAPI_OfficialLineups_RU5_Prematch_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the Sisal platform as an authorized user on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and can access the prematch section.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to a prematch event for a brand/manifestation where Fantacalcio is prioritized but currently unavailable.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch event details are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the official lineups are displayed for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: Official lineups are visible for the match.

Steps.Step Description: Check the data source of the displayed lineups (should be Sportradar Soccer V4 API).
Steps.Expected Result: Lineups are sourced from Sportradar Soccer V4 API, not Fantacalcio.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and access to the Sisal platform.
2. At least one prematch event exists for a brand/manifestation with Fantacalcio as the prioritized provider.
3. Fantacalcio API is unavailable for the selected match.
4. Sportradar Soccer V4 API is operational and integrated.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, event ID for a match with Fantacalcio exclusion, API access logs.
test_cases.Expected Result: When Fantacalcio API is unavailable for prioritized brands/manifestations, the system displays official lineups sourced exclusively from Sportradar Soccer V4 API in the prematch section.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers fallback mechanism for desktop web; does not cover mobile or app channels.
test_cases._polarion: Soluzione di Fallback in caso di esclusione Fantacalcio (RU 5)

test_cases.Title: CorrectLineupOrder_001_RU7_VistaCampoModuloGioco_TEST_Smartphone

Steps.Step Description: Access the Sisal client 'Campetto' view on a smartphone device.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Campetto' view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the API call to 'ProbableLineup Full' for a selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: API response is received containing 'Starter' and 'Trend' fields for both teams.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Trend' field contains a valid formation code (e.g., '4231').
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Trend' field displays a valid formation code.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Starter' field contains an ordered list of 11 players.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Starter' field lists 11 players in a specific order.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the lineup on the 'Campetto' view is rendered according to the formation in 'Trend' and the order of players in 'Starter', ignoring the 'position' attribute.
Steps.Expected Result: Players are displayed in the correct positions on the field, following the formation and order from the API response, not the 'position' attribute.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into the Sisal client on a smartphone.
2. The 'ProbableLineup Full' API is accessible and returns valid data for the selected match.
3. The match has both 'Starter' and 'Trend' fields populated in the API response.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample API response with 'Trend':'4231' and 11 ordered players in 'Starter'.
test_cases.Expected Result: The lineup is displayed on the field according to the formation in 'Trend' and the order of players in 'Starter', ignoring the 'position' attribute.

Steps.Step Description: Check that players are positioned according to the order in 'Starter', from top to bottom and right to left, matching the new formation.

test_cases.Dataset: Sample API response with 'Trend':'352' and 11 ordered players in 'Starter'.
test_cases.Expected Result: The field layout and player positions update to match the new formation and order from the API response.

test_cases.Title: LastUpdateDisplay_001_RU18_ProbableLineupFULL_TEST_Smartphone

Steps.Step Description: Open the application on a Smartphone device and navigate to the 'Lista' view displaying the list of matches.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Lista' view is displayed with a list of matches.

Steps.Step Description: For each match, observe the displayed 'Ultimo Aggiornamento' (last update) information.
Steps.Expected Result: Each match displays a date and time for the last update.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the date and time format for 'Ultimo Aggiornamento' is GG/MM/AAAA - HH:MM.
Steps.Expected Result: The date and time are displayed in the correct format (e.g., 25/06/2024 - 14:30).

Steps.Step Description: Cross-check the displayed 'Ultimo Aggiornamento' value with the 'lastUpdate' field from the ProbableLineupFULL API for each match.
Steps.Expected Result: The displayed value matches exactly with the API response for each match.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The application is installed on the Smartphone.
2. The user is logged in (if required).
3. The ProbableLineupFULL API is accessible and returns valid data for matches.
4. There are matches available in the 'Lista' view.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample matches with known 'lastUpdate' values in the API (e.g., Match A: 25/06/2024 - 14:30).
test_cases.Expected Result: For every match in the 'Lista' view, the 'Ultimo Aggiornamento' is displayed in the correct format and matches the API value.
